core_principles: Depth over Flatness: Use 3D space and layered glass UI
Rarity is King: Color coding must be aggressive and consistent
Motion is Feedback: Every click, hover, and reveal needs juice
Glassmorphism: UI floats above the aquarium, never hiding it completely

three_js_guidelines.lighting: AmbientLight intensity 0.5, PointLight (blue/purple) at top corners
three_js_guidelines.fish_behavior: Wander randomly, avoid walls, smooth turns (lerp rotation)
three_js_guidelines.interaction: Raycaster for click detection. On click -> Select fish state -> Open Sidebar

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Setup React-Three-Fiber in the main page. The Canvas should be the background.
2. Implement the 'Rarity' logic in CSS first (define utility classes for text-rare, bg-rare, etc).
3. Build the Sidebar as a conditional rendering component that slides in.
4. Use the Gacha Button to trigger a state change that spawns a new fish in 3D space with a 'reveal' effect.
5. Ensure the Leaderboard is scrollable but doesn't take up more than 30% of the screen width.
6. Use 'sonner' for toast notifications when a user unlocks a new fish.
7. Mock the 3D Fish with simple meshes (Sphere/Cone) if models are missing, but apply different colors based on rarity.
8. Authentication page should be a simple centered modal over a blurred aquarium background.
universal_guidelines: Use backdrop-blur-xl for all UI panels to ensure text readability over the 3D scene.
All interactive elements must have hover states (brightness-110 or scale-105).
Add 'data-testid' to all buttons and inputs.
